cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SW of Fort Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northeast across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico toward the south-central Florida Peninsula, then over the Atlantic north of the north-western Bahamas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Naples–Marco Island, Florida (south-western Florida Peninsula)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuban provinces of Matanzas and the Isle of Youth
weather_observation.warning_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Card Sound Bridge, including Port Everglades
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-east Florida Peninsula (Card Sound Bridge northward to Volusia/Brevard County Line), Florida Keys and adjacent Gulf and Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, gusts higher) possible Saturday with a 29% chance of sustained 34-kt winds and a low (3%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor coastal inundation (around 1-2 ft) possible along the Atlantic beaches; significant surge above 3 ft not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with local maxima to 12 inches could trigger flash and urban flooding across Broward County and Port Everglades.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible beginning Friday evening through Saturday.
